title: SERGIO CHION (0000-0002-7955-3163) - ORCID | Connecting Research and Researchers

biography.value:
Dr. Sergio J. Chión obtained his Ph.D from Stanford University. His major areas of academic interest are on Markovian modeling of human behavior and interaction, strategical thinking, managerial competencies development, and structural equation modeling. Currently, Dr. Chion is full time professor and researcher at CENTRUM, the Graduate School of Business of Pontificia Universidad Católica del Perú. He is Chair for the courses of macroeconomics at the MBA programs, and the course of Quantitative Research Methodology at the doctoral programs. He is also the Director of the Management Education Research Center at CENTRUM. Dr. Chión has published research articles in different top academic journals, and has published books on structural equation modeling and fixed-income portfolio management.

In his non-academic professional experience, Dr. Chion has been advisor to two ministers of economy and one minister of health in Perú. He has been member of the board of directors of the Peruvian equivalent of the Security Exchange Commission. In the private sector, Dr. Chión has given extensive consultancy services at insurance corporations as well as their Superintendence, in the fields of risk management, finance and economics.
